channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.title: Report E-2024050243
item.description:
Report E-2024050243

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-14T15:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/04/2024 Veolia employees were unloading a cubic yard box into a trailer at the 10-Day transfer area in Veolia, South Windsor, CT facility when an employee noticed a few drops of liquid coming out of a cubic yard box. Only a couple of drops were observed under the cubic yard box. The employees noticed the leak right away and quickly put down some spill pads to contain the leak. Employees proceeded to open the container and observed many inner paint related material containers were dented or leaking inside the cubic yard box. Employees righted the inner containers, poured absorbent into the cubic yard box to prevent any further leaks, and transported the container to the ultimate disposal facility.

item.title: Report X-2024050309
item.description:
Report X-2024050309

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-10T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-04
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The box is marked with a Corrosive Diamond. The box has two large wet marks on the side of it near the top. 2X1 Gallon bottles of Formical-4 were found to have loose caps and the seal under the caps were broken allowing them to leak.
